articles.title: Jay Chou to Malaysian soccer fans: 'I can postpone my concert, it's not a problem' - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: The Mandopop singer addresses ire over reduced seating for the ASEAN Football Federation Cup (AFF) held in Kuala Lumpur.
articles.content:
The 43-year-old then went on to add, "I hope everyone would be happy when they come to my concert."
Fans of the singer came to his defense.

articles.title: With few entry tests, Southeast Asia may gain most from China's travel revival - Reuters
articles.description: Southeast Asia's tourist economies are set to be leading beneficiaries of China's scrapping of travel bans as they have steered clear of the COVID-19 tests before entry that Europe, Japan and the United States have imposed on Chinese visitors.
articles.content: SINGAPORE, Jan 6 (Reuters) - Southeast Asia's tourist economies are set to be leading beneficiaries of China's scrapping of travel bans as they have steered clear of the COVID-19 tests before entry t… [+4002 chars]

articles.author: Mark Pratt
articles.title: Nate Thayer, reporter who interviewed Pol Pot, dies - The Associated Press
articles.description: Nate Thayer, a fearless reporter who survived several brushes with death over decades covering conflict in Southeast Asia and was the last western journalist to interview Pol Pot, the leader of the murderous Khmer Rouge regime in Cambodia, has died.
articles.content: American journalist Nate Thayer, of Falmouth, Mass., sits bandaged in a hotel room on Oct. 15, 1989 in Aranyaprathet, Thailand, after he was injured in a land mine explosion on his return from Cambod… [+5797 chars]
